results.title: Ned Kelly [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Woodfall Film Productions, Neil Hartley and Tony Richardson
results.brief_description: Ned Kelly, an impoverished Irish Catholic, is driven to crime by the persecution of the English Protestant establishment and their agents, a corrupt police force. The powerful figures - judge, police chief, landowner - are presented as virtual caricatures. The film takes a folkloric approach in emphasising the general at the expense of the particular in portraying Ned’s grim existence. There is something of a mixture of styles. The setting is carefully established but the camerawork is lyrical rather than observational. At times (as in the white bull sequence) the film seems to approach abstraction while at others the mood borders on that of musical, even pseudo-Restoration comedy. Mick Jagger is subdued in the role of Ned to the point of subverting the legend. Music by Shel Silverstein. Cast also includes Allen Bickford, Geoff Gilmour, Mark McManus, Serge Lazareff, Peter Sumner, Ken Shorter, Diane Craig.

results.title: Ned Kelly (VR)
results.brief_description: Ian MacLarty’s Ned Kelly VR game, made in Vertex Meadow, lets players inhabit the limited view of the famous bushranger’s iconic helmet.

results.title: Ned Kelly (2003)
results.creator_credit: Universal Pictures, Studio Canal, Working Title Films, Nelson Woss, Lynda House and Gregor Jordan
results.brief_description: Directed by Gregor Jordan and starring Heath Ledger in the title role, this is the story of legendary Australian bushranger Ned Kelly and his gang. This period piece, set in late 1870’s, is complete with outlaws, romance and homemade armour. Shot in Australia this costumed drama tells the tale of young Ned and his friends as they struggle with the harsh realities of life in country Australia at the time. Based on the novel “Our Sunshine” by Robert Drewe. Cast includes Orlando Bloom, Naomi Watts, Joel Edgerton and Geoffrey Rush.

results.title: Nectar eaters
results.creator_credit: Comalco Australia, Art Mayer and Graham Pizzey
results.brief_description: The majority of Australia’s 12,000 plant species produce flowers attractive to pollinating agents to ensure the production of fertile seed This film, shot in southern Queensland and northern New South Wales, looks at some of the more important Australian blossom feeders and pollinators including the Sugar Glider, Eastern Pigmy Possum, Scarlet Honeyeater, Rainbow Lorikeet and the Grey-headed Flying Fox.

results.title: Nebule
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Rene Jodoin and Bernard Longpre
results.brief_description: In this animated film a black line becomes a magic cord to serve a small child’s fancy. In Nebule’s hands it becomes whatever he wills and the metamorphoses, played out against a soft, pastelcolored background, encompass the world of a child’s fears and fancies. A film without narration.

results.title: Neat on Paper
results.creator_credit: Sydney Filmmakers' Co-op Action Group, Mandy King, James Kesteven and Miriana Marusic
results.brief_description: The Sydney Filmmakers’ Co-operative was a major national agency for the distribution and exhibition of independently produced Australian film and video for over 20 years. This program examines the issues surrounding its closure in 1986.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Sydney Filmmakers’ Co-op Action Group, Mandy King, James Kesteven and Miriana Marusic

results.title: Nearly normal Nimbin
results.creator_credit: Gaia Films, Jeni Kendell and Paul Tait
results.brief_description: Nimbin is best known as Australia’s answer to Woodstock. A one-street town where the residents lead an alternative lifestyle. Land is owned collectively and the values of peace love and happiness are put into practice. This video is in threee parts; “Peace, love and burnt rice” is a look at how Nimbin came into being, “Sects, drugs and rock ‘n’ roll” is a look at the prevealence of drugs in the town, and “Sensitive New Age guise” looks at the spirit of the town which has developed community living and tribal life. It investigates the practices of sharing land, buildings, and sometimes partners and children - experimenting with life beyond the nuclear family, does it work?
